intro: Froesia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan froesia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
